I have finally decided on my smallest team.

If I was starting from scratch and NOT cheating with money, I would 
start off with 1 elf, 2 mages, and 2 clerics.  The first mage to
reach 
 the point of being able to be converted into an archmage would 
changed into an archmage.  The purpose of the elf is to collect 
gold/silver that other characters can not reach.

If I was starting from scratch and minimally cheating with money, I 
would start with a level 13 archmage, a level 13 mage, and 2 level 10 
clerics.  This team can take on any level no matter how difficult.  
Let me explain the purpose of each member of the team:

The 2 level 10 clerics - raise extra ghosts and skeletons to handle 
large numbers of opposition

The level 13 archmage - summon images and fire elementals to handle 
large numbers of opposition plus the chain lightning to  handle 
multiple problems

The level 13 mage - freeze time to help handle overwhelming numbers.  
Particularly usefull when dealing with large numbers of slime that 
keep multiplying.

I could design a level that no cleric would be able to beat without 
help from pre-existing ghosts or mages/archmages.  The smallest team
I 
would go with is one archmage.  The 2nd smallest is one archmage and 
one cleric.  The 3rd smallest is one archmage and 2 clerics.  The 4th 
smallest is the aformentioned 1 archmage, 1 mage, and 2 clerics.

I find it usefull when I have completed a scenario to raise a ghost
to 
 pick up all gold/silver anywhere on the scenario in a hurry.  Am I 
the only way to do this?

Btw, people before sending out email asking for more scenarios,
please 
check recent posts to see if anyone has released new scenarios 
recently (and yes, someone has).
